titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Science Fiction and Comic Fanzine Collection, 1952-2005 SC.1980.02
titlestmt.author: Katharine Pigliacelli.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 10:06:37 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Science Fiction and Comic Fanzine Collection
did.abstract: The collection contains science fiction and comic fanzines, published both locally and nationally, between 1956 and 2005. A bulk of the collection is from the 1970's.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: A fanzine defined, is "a non-professional and non-official publication produced by enthusiasts of a particular cultural phenomenon for the pleasure of others who share their interest." Fanzines were actually popularized within science fiction fandom before being adopted by other communities. Before the internet, fanzines provided people a vehicle to share thoughts, ideas, activities, art, and critique. The zines were often times produced at home, libraries, schools, and anywhere that allowed access to mimeograph machines and later, photocopiers. Science fiction and comic fanzines are a great resource for those interested in tracing the history of fandom and the subculture as a whole.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Science Fiction and Comic Fanzine collection includes fanzines published primarily in the United States, including a considerable amount published locally and regionally and some of foreign origin. Contents of the fanzines include reviews, opinion, short fiction, letters, cartoons and drawings, and an exchange of information about science fiction conventions and fan interests.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by graduate student assistant, Katharine Pigliacelli, during the fall of 2016, under the supervision of archivist Jennifer Needham.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is divided into the following three series, arranged alphabetically:

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Science Fiction and Fanzine Collection, 1952-2005, SC.1980.02, Special Collections Department, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Science Fiction and Fanzine Collection, 1952-2005, SC.1980.02, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The fanzine collection originated from multiple donors, including members of the Pittsburgh Comix Club and individual science fiction and comic fans from Pittsburgh.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes comic fanzines created between 1958 and 1983 that reflect a vareity of comic book fandom and include general interest as well as fanzines devoted to specific titles and characters. While the series contains predominately fanzines, also included are some amateur and underground comic books and collector guides.
The series is organized alphabetically and when possible, the publication information, including location, publisher and editors(s) are noted in the scope and content notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes science fiction fanzines created between 1964 and 1980 by national and local individuals, organizations, and clubs. The series is organized alphabetically and when possible, the publication information, including location, publisher and editors(s) are noted in the scope and content notes.
